issue.title: unable to run async tests in UWP

repository.name: nunit.xamarin
repository.description: NUnit test runners for Xamarin and mobile devices - No longer maintained

body: They should work in UWP, but they don't because of the code outlined in this issue. To test async in UWP, we will need to fix and push an update to the framework.

I'm too tired tonight to think clearly, so I'll look at it in the AM. 

Some stuff off the bat: if this is framework only, do we have to release everything else? Could we just do a new framework release for those who need it on myget? Could we bundle an updated framework with the runner until we can bring both projects in sync?

I'll look at the code tomorrow.

I want to test this with. NET Core too. It could be a more general issue on
multiple platforms which would negate a runner only update.
On Nov 20, 2015 12:09 AM, "CharliePoole" notifications@github.com wrote:

> I'm too tired tonight to think clearly, so I'll look at it in the AM.
> 
> Some stuff off the bat: if this is framework only, do we have to release
> everything else? Could we just do a new framework release for those who
> need it on myget? Could we bundle an updated framework with the runner
> until we can bring both projects in sync?
> 
> I'll look at the code tomorrow.
> 
> 窶能n> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/nunit/nunit/issues/1037#issuecomment-158281121.

Not sure if it helps, but I did not see this problem in Win32, iOS or
Android.

wrote:

issue.title: Async support on Windows 10
issue.body:
Fixes #1037 

Do not attempt to get Result from VoidTaskResult which is not supported on all platforms
